subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: The SchemaCrawler plugin example demonstrates how to extend SchemaCrawler in two ways - one to add a new command, and the other to create a new custom linter.
The Maven project in this example has a new SchemaCrawler command, and a custom linter.

ul.li: The new SchemaCrawler command is created by implmenting CommandProvider. The command provider registration is in the META-INF/services/schemacrawler.tools.executable.CommandProvider file.

To create the new lint, we have followed the steps in
SchemaCrawler Lint - Lint Extensions.

ol.li: Make sure that Maven is on your path.
Start a command shell in the schemacrawler-plugin example directory.
Run mvn package to build the SchemaCrawler plugin jar, .\target\schemacrawler-plugin-test-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar .

Copy the SchemaCrawler plugin jar, schemacrawler-plugin\target\schemacrawler-plugin-test-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar to the SchemaCrawler lib folder, _schemacrawler\lib where it will be added to the classpath automatically.
Follow the instructions in the commandline example.
To run the custom linter, along with the standard linters, run sc.cmd -infolevel=standard -command=lint (or sc.sh -infolevel=standard -command=lint on Unix)
Run sc.cmd -help (or sc.sh -help on Unix). This will show you the newly added command, additional, in the command line options.
To use the newly added command, run sc.cmd -infolevel=standard -command=additional (or sc.sh -infolevel=standard -command=additional on Unix)
Try defining a new database connection, using your favorite database and driver.
